WELCOME BACK



The end of our summer recess



TOPIC: Embraced by Great Compassion.

Explore the experience of transcending the egoic self through our annual Water Ceremony, in which members and friends bring in and pour a vial of water into a large and clear vase. The water represents a place they visited or a certain experience during the summer break in which they felt interconnected with life and/or being embraced by the Oneness of Reality, symbolized by Amida Buddha. As the various water is mixed in the vase, it becomes a metaphor of the vast matrix of life. The water may really come from a place or may be symbolic (tap water).
